boardgame.name: Das Heldenbrevier der Siebenwindküste
Hero's Breviary of the Warring Kingdoms
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

The windward shores of the Sevenwind Coast are home to ancient nobility, unyielding clan warriors, wandering minstrels, but also powerful fairies who influence the destiny of mortals from the hidden Otherworld.

The Heldenbrevier accompanies four inhabitants of the coastal region, who could not be more different: a cheerful Winhaller Bardin, a battle-tested border rider, a proud clan warrior from the Windhag and an efferd-faithful seafarer from the Sturminseln. In diaries and letters, the unequal companions tell of their adventurous search for the lost cancer knight Cancradoc and their journey through the country on the Great River. Their way leads them from the mystical Schleiensee through the dark Muhrsape to the colourful port metropolis of Havena.

Learn more about the dangers of the seven-wind coast, the stubbornness of the Windhager, the deep-seated hatred of the Northern Marches, the work of powerful fairies and the unshakable belief in Efferd, the lord of wind and waves.

The hero's breviary reports on this journey in intra-Aventure sources and thereby provides deep insights into the thinking and emotional world of the locals. It offers countless inspirations for exciting stories, for further deepening the background and for designing your own hero.

The Heldenbrevier is an atmospheric addition to the regional game aid Die Siebenwindküste. It is suitable for masters as well as players and does not require any rule knowledge.


Klappentext

Die windumtosten Gestade der Siebenwindküste sind die Heimat uralten Adels, unbeugsamer Sippenkrieger, wandernder Zauberbarden aber auch machtvoller Feenwesen, die aus der verborgenen Anderswelt die Geschicke der Sterblichen beeinflussen.

Das Heldenbrevier begleitet vier Bewohner der Küstenlande, die unterschiedlicher nicht sein könnten: eine lebenslustige Winhaller Bardin, einen kampferprobten Grenzreiter, einen stolzen Sippenkrieger aus dem Windhag und eine efferdgläubige Seefahrerin von den Sturminseln. In Tagebüchern und Briefen berichten die ungleichen Gefährten von ihrer abenteuerlichen Suche nach dem verschollenen Krebsritter Cancradoc und ihrer Reise durch das Land am Großen Fluss. Ihr Weg führt sie vom mystischen Schleiensee durch die finstere Muhrsape bis zur bunten Hafenmetropole Havena.

Erfahre mehr über die Gefahren der Siebenwindküste, die Eigensinnigkeit der Windhager, den tiefsitzenden Hass auf die Nordmärker, das Wirken mächtiger Feen und den unerschütterlichen Glauben an Efferd, den Herrn von Wind und Wogen.

Das Heldenbrevier berichtet in inneraventurischen Quellen von dieser Reise und gewährt dabei tiefe Einblicke in das Denken und die Gefühlswelt der Einheimischen. Es bietet unzählige Inspirationen für spannende Geschichten, zur weiteren Vertiefung des Hintergrunds sowie zur Ausgestaltung deines eigenen Helden.

Das Heldenbrevier ist eine stimmungsvolle Ergänzung zur Regionalspielhilfe Die Siebenwindküste. Es ist für Meister wie Spieler gleichermaßen geeignet, und erfordert keinerlei Regelkenntnisse.

boardgame.name: Das Heldenbrevier der Streitenden Königreiche
The Hero's Breviary of the Warring Kingdoms
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

For almost two millennia, the eternal dispute between Nostria and Andergast, which is therefore also called The Fighting Kingdoms, has been smouldering.

The Heldenbrevier accompanies two brave knights on their way through Nostria & Andergast, which could hardly be more different. While a nostrier leaves the coastal lake country, an Andergaster from the Albumin free reign in the east of Lake Thuran sets out on a journey. What will they experience? What dangers lurk on their way? How do they perceive their home and its inhabitants? And what will happen when the two finally meet?

Discover the forests of forest wilderness, the mysterious cliffs of Hallerû in the Ingvaltal and the deadly Messergrass steppe. Learn first-hand about the ancient feud between the rich, their inhabitants and the spirits of the land that are worshipped here. What do Nostrians and Andergasters really think about their rulers, the magic power of witches or the mysterious Sumen? And what about the enemy on the other side of the border?

The hero's breviary reports on this journey in intra-Aventure sources and thereby provides deep insights into the thinking and emotional world of the locals. It offers countless inspirations for exciting stories, for further deepening the background and for designing your own hero.

The Heldenbrevier is an atmospheric addition to the regional game aid Die Streitenden Königreiche. It is suitable for masters as well as players and does not require any rule knowledge.


Klappentext

Schon seit fast zwei Jahrtausenden schwelt der ewige Zwist zwischen Nostria und Andergast, die man daher auch Die Streitenden Königreiche nennt.

Das Heldenbrevier begleitet zwei wackere Ritter auf ihrem Weg durch Nostria & Andergast, die unterschiedlicher kaum sein könnten. Während eine Nostrierin aus dem an der Küste gelegenen Seenland aufbricht, macht sich ein Andergaster aus der Freiherrschaft Albumin im Osten des Thuransees auf die Reise. Was werden die beiden erleben? Welche Gefahren lauern auf ihrem Weg? Wie nehmen sie ihre Heimat und seine Bewohner wahr? Und was wird geschehen, wenn die beiden schließlich aufeinander treffen?

Entdecke die Wälder der Waldwildnis, die geheimnisvollen Klippen von Hallerû im Ingvaltal und die tödliche Messergrassteppe. Erfahre aus erster Hand mehr über die uralte Fehde zwischen den Reichen, über ihre Bewohner und die Geister des Landes, die hier verehrt werden. Was denken Nostrier und Andergaster wirklich über ihre Herrscher, die Zaubermacht der Hexen oder die geheimnisvollen Sumen? Und was über den Feind auf der anderen Seite der Grenze?

Das Heldenbrevier berichtet in inneraventurischen Quellen von dieser Reise und gewährt dabei tiefe Einblicke in das Denken und die Gefühlswelt der Einheimischen. Es bietet unzählige Inspirationen für spannende Geschichten, zur weiteren Vertiefung des Hintergrunds sowie zur Ausgestaltung deines eigenen Helden.

Das Heldenbrevier ist eine stimmungsvolle Ergänzung zur Regionalspielhilfe Die Streitenden Königreiche. Es ist für Meister wie Spieler gleichermaßen geeignet, und erfordert keinerlei Regelkenntnisse.

boardgame.name: Looper
boardgame.description:
Looper is played on a toroidal board represented by a square grid. Only orthogonally adjacent cells count as adjacent. (Thus, there are no diagonal connections.)

On each turn, a player places 1,2 or 3 black stones on any vacant intersection. Alternatively, on his/her turn a player may announce "take", after which the opponent continues with white and the taker with black, alternately playing single stones onto empty intersections.

Black wins by making a global loop. White wins by preventing this. A global loop is a string of connected stones that circles the torus (either horizontally, vertically, or both horizontally and vertically) and connects back to itself.

A full guide to rules and tactics is here: https://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/178192/looper-rules-and-t...

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Scavenge
boardgame.description:
Scavenge through a house's glorious garbage. Claim your own back scratcher, metal hat, or grand cheeseburger! But watch out. You might knock over a garbage can and cause a commotion if you are too greedy! When furry critters cause too much noise, they scare easily and leave all their spoils behind. So much for a lucky find!

Scavenge is a family oriented 2-5 player press-your-luck game where you and other raccoons rummage through the rubbish while the game tries to reclaim your tastiest treats. Will you store your loot in your Secret Stash at just the right time? Who will find the 3 mythical cheeseburgers. It's every player against the game. There are no player vs player attack mechanics. Feel the joy when someone finds something great and the angst when you had it all but you pushed your luck one card too far!

boardgame.name: Top Scent
boardgame.description:
Put your sense of smell to the test with Top Scent, a fun party game by the French toy maker Sentosphère. This simple game features 96 bright adorable fruit cards and 12 aroma diffusers.

Deal out the cards equally among all players. The players sit in a circle and must smell the same aroma diffuser without revealing their answer to the other players. Roll the dice to determine how many times you will have to find the fruit on the cards. All players must put their cards successively in the middle to form a pile in the center of the game.

Once the recognized fruit appears the number of times as indicated on the dice, the first player to slap the pile collects those cards. The winner is the one who won the most cards at the end of the game.

boardgame.name: Sinä vuonna 1918
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb translated into English:
Choose your side. That year the land was cold and covered in thick white layer, which stained with the gore of brothers and sisters. The people were split. Everyone had to choose their side.

Choose your story. What would your story be like in the first moments of Finnish independence? Would you retain your goodness or would your moral falter? Could you stay as a civilian, neutral? Whether you are man or woman, red or white, the life's unexpected turns and decisions made in the blink of an eye will shape your story forward.

Choose your destiny. Mike Pohjola's Sinä Vuonna 1918 (double meaning, in English either "You on Year 1918" or "That Year 1918") is an immersive novel that takes the reader to the time of the Finnish Civil War, to the most tearing times of divided Finland. The novel contains millions of stories within single covers.

The main character of the story is you, the reader. Make your choices and read your destiny - and once you have lived one lifestory, immerse yourself in the next.

Publisher blurb in Finnish:
Valitse puolesi. Sinä vuonna maa oli kylmä ja peittyi paksuun valkoiseen kerrokseen, joka tahrautui veljistä ja siskoista vuotavaan hurmeeseen. Kansassa oli kipeä repeämä. Jokaisen oli valittava puolensa.

Valitse tarinasi. Millainen olisi sinun tarinasi Suomen itsenäisyyden ensihetkillä? Säilyisikö hyvyytesi vai horjuisiko moraalisi? Kykenisitkö pysymään siviilissä, puolueettomana? Olit mies tai nainen, punainen tai valkoinen, elämän sattumanvaraiset oikut ja silmänräpäyksessä tehdyt valinnat muovaavat tarinaasi eteenpäin.

Valitse kohtalosi. Mike Pohjolan Sinä vuonna 1918 on immersiivinen romaani, joka vie lukijan sisällissodan aikaan, kahtiajakautuneen Suomen raastavimpiin hetkiin. Romaani sisältää miljoonia erilaisia tarinoita yksissä kansissa.

Tarinan pääosassa olet sinä, lukija. Tee valintasi ja lue kohtalosi – ja kun olet kokenut yhden elämäntarinan, uppoa seuraavaan.

boardgame.name: The Law
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

The Hive, The Metropolis, The Mega-City...estimates put the population at almost half a billion, but no one really knows.

In the past, before the Corporate Wars, there were governments, nations, and armies. There were concepts like democracy and freedom...and citizen's rights. But even those things are an uncertainty under the tainted clouds of acid rain and within the barrier walls protecting the cities from the irradiated wastelands that cover 90% of the planet.

The only thing that's certain is that crime is everywhere, and there aren't enough peacekeepers to keep things under control.

Peacekeepers come in three varieties...

Private security. Well equipped and well paid, but often disturb the peace more than they keep it.

Vigilantes. Dedicated and dangerous, but often unable to move beyond their focus on a single cause.

...and...

The Agents of the Law. Outnumbered, but not necessarily outgunned. The ultimate symbols of the justice in the city, but sometimes that justice is obscured in shades of grey. It's their stories we follow.

---

The Law is a roleplaying game by Vulpinoid Studios and uses the latest evolution of a system that began in the FUBAR roleplaying game. Characters creation is a fast process designed to quickly get players into the action, and storytelling involves a fun game mechanisms where players roll two or more dice then choose which of them indicates their degree of success, and which indicates any sacrifices made in the attempt.

The whole game is designed in comic book format, illustration heavy, and filled with icons and accessible terms to make it aproachable for new roleplayers and those who are veterans of other systems.
